en.purpose: To assess the absolute risk of developing prostate cancer based on age and hereditary factors.
en.use: Use to assess the absolute risk percentage based on the patient's family history configuration as defined by the Swedish National Care Program.
en.misuse: Not to be used for calculation of risk based on PSA levels or other biomarkers.

other_details.references:
Johns LE, Houlston RS. A systematic review and meta-analysis of familial prostate cancer risk. BJU Int. 2003 Jun;91(9):789-94. doi: 10.1046/j.1464-410x.2003.04232.x. PMID: 12780833.

Bratt O, Drevin L, Akre O, Garmo H, Stattin P. Family History and Probability of Prostate Cancer, Differentiated by Risk Category: A Nationwide Population-Based Study. J Natl Cancer Inst. 2016 Jul 10;108(10):djw110. doi: 10.1093/jnci/djw110. PMID: 27400876.

Nationellt vårdprogram prostatacancer [Internet]. Regionala cancercentrum i samverkan; 2023 [cited 2025 Nov 18]. Available from: https://kunskapsbanken.cancercentrum.se/diagnoser/prostatacancer/vardprogram/testning-for-tidig-diagnostik/
Jansson KF, Akre O, Garmo H, Bill-Axelson A, Adolfsson J, Stattin P, Bratt O. Risk of prostate cancer in men with a history of prostate cancer in the family. JNCI: Journal of the National Cancer Institute. 2012;104(12).
other_details.en: Calculates absolute risk for prostate cancer at different ages depending on heredity.
